channel.title: Skilling And Combat Levels
channel.description: I'm trying to seperate the skilling skill from the combat skills so I can make a guild. Here is what I have, but I don't understand what's wrong. What would make this work: Here is what I have in player.java : [code=java]//public boolean skillingLevels = playerLevel[7], playerLevel[8], playerLevel[9], playerLevel[10], playerLevel[11], playerLevel[12], playerLevel[13], playerLevel[14], playerLevel[15], playerLevel[16], playerLevel[17], playerLevel[19], playerLevel[20];[/code]Right now I have it scratched out because of the errors I was getting, but I've tried like 3 different codes with this. I've tried || instead of the , and I've also tried making them all into ints... I honestly don't know what the code would look like. Also, I haven't done the combat skills because these haven't worked yet. If anyone can help me I would greatly appreciate it.

item.title: Skilling And Combat Levels
item.dc:creator: @Owner_satan Owner satan
item.description:
@Owner_satan wrote:

Tried the + that gave me an error as well, trying the method now. Can you explain to me a little more on the method though?
Also, I need it to be public, so I can use the totals in another classfile.

Read full topic

item.title: Skilling And Combat Levels
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

You should probably use the + sign instead of a comma. Or better yet, make a method that does it.

public int calcSkillLevel() {
    int sum = 0;
    for (int skill : NON_COMBAT_SKILLS) {
        sum += getSkillLevel(skill);
    }
    return sum;
}

Read full topic

item.description:
@Owner_satan wrote:

I’m trying to seperate the skilling skill from the combat skills so I can make a guild.
Here is what I have, but I don’t understand what’s wrong. What would make this work:
Here is what I have in player.java :

//public boolean skillingLevels = playerLevel[7], playerLevel[8], playerLevel[9], playerLevel[10], playerLevel[11], playerLevel[12], playerLevel[13], playerLevel[14], playerLevel[15], playerLevel[16], playerLevel[17], playerLevel[19], playerLevel[20];Right now I have it scratched out because of the errors I was getting, but I’ve tried like 3 different codes with this.
